intro: Centrostachys aspera, commonly known as the rough centrostachys, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or dry soils, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its small, yellowish flowers bloom in clusters, adding a subtle ornamental value. Centrostachys aspera is often found in open woodlands and along coastal areas, where it thrives in full sun.
